intro: Saccolabium coarctatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf sicklepod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, typical of many legumes. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
